name: linuron
source: Hughes LD; Palmer DS; Nigsch F and Mitchell JBO. 2008 Why are some properties more difficult to predict than others? A study of QSPR models of solubility; melting point and LogP. J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2008. 48 (1). pp 220?460
Reason: ##The basic unit for comparison can be considered as benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The compound linuron contains a benzene ring, a urea group, and two chlorine atoms. The presence of the urea group (-NH-CO-NH-) will increase the melting point due to the hydrogen bonding capability of the urea group. The chlorine atoms will also increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The overall effect of these structural modifications is to increase the melting point compared to the basic unit of benzene.
